title: It's possible to generate lint with wrong ASCII arrow
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

While writing a new lint, I wrote some code like this:

```rust
cx.struct_span_lint(
    UNGATED_ASYNC_FN_TRACK_CALLER,
    span.with_hi(attr.span.hi()),
    fluent::lint_ungated_async_fn_track_caller,
    |lint| lint,
);
```

I expected to see the resulting warning to look like this (I think??) (note: this is the `.stderr` file but same thing)
```
warning: `#[track_caller]` on async functions is a no-op, unless the `closure_track_caller` feature is enabled
  --> $DIR/issue-104588-no-op-track-caller.rs:4:16
   |
LL |   #[track_caller]
   |  ________________^
LL | | async fn foo() {}
   | |^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(ungated_async_fn_track_caller)]` on by default

warning: 1 warning emitted
```

Instead, this happened:
```
warning: `#[track_caller]` on async functions is a no-op, unless the `closure_track_caller` feature is enabled
  --> $DIR/issue-104588-no-op-track-caller.rs:4:16
   |
LL |   #[track_caller]
   |  ________________^
LL | | async fn foo() {}
   | |_
   |
   = note: `#[warn(ungated_async_fn_track_caller)]` on by default

warning: 1 warning emitted


```

### Meta
I was just using my own branch off of master, this is the commit I noticed the bug in: https://github.com/bryangarza/rust/commit/e589c062de9a415c8f64d0ddb44e9e020ceda300

### Additional notes

I'm not sure if the formatting is incorrect because I was misusing the lint function (cause I shouldn't have been passing in `span.with_hi(attr.span.hi())` to begin with), or if even in this case, the formatting should print out `|^`.
